page.title: 16GETTING ABOUT,PLOCKTON.
page.content: MOST PEOPLE RELY ON{CARS}FOR GETTING ABOUT FROM PLACE TO PLACE.MOST OF THE ROADS ARE{SINGLE TRACK.}WHEN 2 CARS MEET,ONE OF THEM HAS TO GO INTO A {PASSING PLACE}SO THAT THE OTHER CAR CAN GET PAST.THERE ARE TWO TYPES OF{ {PUBLIC TRANSPORT}IN PLOCKTON.FIRSTLY THERE IS THE{TRAIN}WHICH RUNS FROM {KYLE TO INVERNESS.}PLOCKTON HAS ITS OWN STATION AT THE EDGE OF THE VILLAGE.THERE ARE 3 TRAINS EACH WAY EACH DAY EXCEPT ON SUNDAYS.IN SUMMER THE TRAINS ARE BUSY WITH{TOURISTS}WHO COME TO ENJOY THE SCENERY. THERE IS ALSO A{BUS SERVICE}TWICE A DAY BETWEEN PLOCKTON AND KYLE.DURING TERM TIME IT IS A{DOUBLE DECKER} BRINGING PUPILS TO PLOCKTON HIGH SCHOOL.IN THE HOLIDAYS A{MINIBUS}IS BIG ENOUGH FOR THE FEW PASSENGERS. PEOPLE CAN ALSO GET AROUND LOCALLY ON THE{POSTBUS}AS IT DOES ITS ROUNDS.
